tips.colors: Whites for chef’s hat and apron. Reds, oranges and yellows for the food. Blacks for accents like shoes or oven detailing. Don’t just settle for plain white togs, young culinary artists! Give that chef’s outfit some extra sizzle with checkerboard patterns or splatters resembling sauce stains.
tips.techniques: A. Illustrating Specific Elements: For a chef’s toque (hat), use pure white. Create the signature puffy shape by shading the bottom creases with light gray. B. Textured Effects: On a cut of meat or loaf of bread, use heavy pencil shading and cross-hatching to depict the bumpy, irregular texture.
tips.challenge: Ramp up the heat and energy of your chef scenes by choosing a fiery color palette inspired by spicy peppers and other zesty ingredients. Sizzling reds, searing oranges, and pops of yellow and purple can capture the essence of vibrant, flavorful world cuisines. This allows you to practice bold color combinations while recreating the dazzling look and feel of a lively restaurant kitchen or festive dining experience.
